messages.messageBody:
--- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "kidjapan2003" <kidjapan2003@y
...> wrote:
> I am new to the group and have just started my tsuba collection. viz
> a vis iron bones I cannot convince myself I can see them yet (or at
> least in the tsubas I have). Does anyone have a close picture to
> demonstrate?
> Many thanks
> Paul

Try this page:

http://www.ksky.ne.jp/~sumie99/tekkotsu.html


Rich S

Richard Stein, PhD alchemyst@...

The Japanese Sword Index

messages.subject: Re:tekkotsu
messages.msgSnippet: I am new to the group and have just started my tsuba collection. viz a vis iron bones I cannot convince myself I can see them yet (or at least in the tsubas I
messages.messageBody:
I am new to the group and have just started my tsuba collection. viz
a vis iron bones I cannot convince myself I can see them yet (or at
least in the tsubas I have). Does anyone have a close picture to
demonstrate?
Many thanks
Paul

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] tekkotsu
messages.msgSnippet: Mr. Olson, Good to hear from you on the list. Bones and tekkotsu are different words for the same thing. See you on Sunday, Jim ... jim/gordon...what is the
messages.messageBody:
Mr. Olson,
Good to hear from you on the list.

Bones and tekkotsu are different words for the same thing.

See you on Sunday,
Jim
----- Original Message -----


jim/gordon...what is the difference between tekkotsu and "bones"..??



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: RE: [nihontostudy] tekkotsu
messages.msgSnippet: One is Japanese and the other is English. The Japanese expression also includes iron as in iron bones. Gordon ... From: Jeremiah OShea
messages.messageBody:
One is Japanese and the other is English. The Japanese expression also
includes iron as in iron bones.



Gordon
